etymology.description: 大(大) (dà, "big") + 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth, object") = originally depicted a man departing from a cave or city -> meaning "go"
etymology.interpretation: The original form illustrated a man leaving a place, possibly a city or a cave, suggesting the concept of going away or departing. This imagery naturally leads to the modern meaning of "go."

examples.chinese: 我要去学校(我要去學校)。
examples.english: I want to go to school.

examples.chinese: 她去商店(她去商店)，买了一些水果(買了一些水果)。
examples.pinyin: Tā qù shāngdiàn, mǎile yīxiē shuǐguǒ.
examples.english: She went to the shop and bought some fruits.

examples.chinese: 明年我打算去法国(明年我打算去法國)。
examples.english: I plan to go to France next year.
